question: Question_02_(a)
sols:
If we start by simplifying the expression of the function $f$ we have:

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
f(x) = \frac{x^2x^3x^4x^5x^6}{x} = \frac{x^{20}}{x}\end{align*} This function is
not defined at 0 and for all the other value, we can divide and obtain
that

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
f(x) = \frac{x^{20}}{x} = x^{19} \quad \text{if }x \neq 0\end{align*} and so its
derivative is

\begin{align*}\displaystyle
f'(x) = 19 x^{18} \quad \text{if }x \neq 0\end{align*}
hints: Simplifying first will make your life easier.
